Exaggerate: The claim exaggerates by stating that Joe Biden was asleep during a live TV interview when in fact the video is a montage and he did not fall asleep on live TV.
Lack enough support: The claim lacks enough support as it is based on a manipulated video montage and does not provide any additional evidence or sources to back up the claim.
Problematic assumption: The claim assumes that Joe Biden was asleep during the TV interview based on visual clues and the presence of snoring noises, but fails to consider alternative explanations or possibilities.
Exist alternative explanation: The claim fails to consider the alternative explanation that Joe Biden may have simply lowered his eyes or blinked during the video, as seen in the endorsement video by Hillary Clinton.
Falters at times: The claim falters at times by presenting misleading information and relying on manipulated video footage to support the assertion that Joe Biden was asleep during the interview.
Contradict fact: The claim contradicts the fact that the video is a montage and that Joe Biden did not fall asleep on live TV, as confirmed by multiple sources and experts.
Understate: There is no evident understatement bias in the provided claim.
